page.title: 07The garage, Greenhaugh
page.content: 50 years ago Greenhaugh had a busy blacksmith's shop which shod the farm horses and kept the farm machinery working. With the demise of the farm horse this closed. In 1980 it was converted to the requirements of a modern motor repair business. It is a one man business with only occasional help and now has a comprehensive collection of tools. His speciality is Citroen, but he can service and repair all kinds of vehicles including farm machinery. Customers come from as far away as Otterburn, Wark and Kielder. The garage certainly fills a local need and is always busy. Perhaps ironically he is keeping the wheels rolling as did his predecessor the bkacksmith. The power however is motor not horse.
